TextpageLeftNav.bodyText:
Data Transfer

Data transfer means that data is moved in and out of Azure data centers that are not explicitly covered by Content Delivery Network pricing.

Pricing Details

Input and output of data:

Users of the 1 RMB Trial receive 50GB of free data. In the event of excess of the data transmission usage limit, the customer's account will be suspended without prior notice and the free credit limit will be set to "0". You can click here to check your data usage in real time.

Starting June 1, 2016, official paying users will enjoy the first 1TB (1024GB) of data free of charge each month when using incoming data transmission services. Users in excess of 1TB of free data will be charged at the following data transmission rates.

Input data (data transmission into the data center): RMB 0.67/GB

Output data (data transmission from the data center): RMB 0.67/GB

FAQs

Expand all
  • Is there a fee for data transfer between Azure services located in the same region (East China Data Center or North China Data Center)?

    No. For example, data transfer within an Azure SQL Database in the same region (East China Data Center or North China Data Center) will not incur any additional costs.

  • Is there a fee for data transfer between Azure services located in two different regions (East China Data Center and North China Data Center)?

    Yes, input and output data between various Azure services located in two different regions (East China Data Center and North China Data Center) needs to be charged according to the pricing.

Support and Service Level Agreements

If you have any questions or need help, please visit Azure Support to select self-service or any other methods to contact us for support.

Data transfer doesn’t provide a service level agreement. If you want to learn about the details of our server level agreement, please access the Service Levels Agreements page.

TextpageLeftNav.metaDescription: Learn about the price details of Data Transfer (Data Transfer). Data transfer means that data is transmitted into and from Azure data centers outside of those that are explicitly covered by content delivery network pricing. A 1 RMB Trial gets you RMB 1,500 in service credits, or you can become an Azure pay-in-advance user through direct purchasing and enjoy the highest 99.99% service level agreement.
